event.name: ANOMALY_CEL_QUESTIONS
event.text: Before you even have a chance to observe your surroundings, a large Slug Transport lurches towards you and beams a Slug onto your ship. Dressed in a freshly ironed suit and with a strangely familiar appearance you can't quite put your finger on, he puts down a large briefcase on a nearby table and pulls a stack of neatly organized papers and places them before him, all without looking at or speaking to you.

The Slug gazes up casually and readjusts the papers. "Hello, ssstranger. Would you care to anssswer sssome... quessstionsss?" Without waiting for an answer, the Slug immediately begins reading off of his sheet. "Let usss... begin. Quessstion one. Have you ever noticed anything... unusssual within the realitiesss you have visssited? Thingsss which... ssshould not be?"

"Isss that... sssso? Hmm." The Slug scribbles something down on his paper. "Quessstion... two. Hasss an advanced AI ever utilized technology you would consssider... otherworldly... to sssubjugate your free will?"

The Slug lets out a faint laugh and scribbles something else down. "Quesstion three. Have you ever encountered or heard of what might be consssidered a... memetic hazard? In particular, one involving a sssubssstance commonly referred to asss chocolate pudding?"
"I sssee. I will... report thisss back to my employersss. Let usss move on."
"Very well then." The Slug draws an X on his paper and fiddles with his pen. "Let usss move on."
"Either you are... very unobssservant, or I am in the... wrong clusssster. Either way, I ssssee thiss quessstionaire hasss no reassson to continue. Thank you for your time."

"Isss that... sssso? Well... then I ssssuppose that anssswersss all I needed from you. Goodbye, ssstranger." Without another word, the Slug places his papers back into his briefcase and beams away, following by his ship jumping away moments later.

event.name: ANOMALY_QUESTIONS_2
event.text: "Quesssstion four. Have you ever engaged with or encountered an anomalousss object or entity which interferesss with the very fabric of your reality? Perhapssss... cleaning sssuppliesss?"
"Oh... Thank you for informing me. I'm afraid I will have to... confissscate thisss, but allow me to offer fair compensssation. Now, let'sss move on."

The Slug glances up, his infallible composure finally shattered: "Where... did you get thisss? You ssshould... no... You sshould NOT have thissss. What have you done? Do you... even realissse the missstake you have made? It isss... too late. We will have to... quarantine thisss reality. I mussst leave and inform my employersss."
"Hm. People are never ssssure on that one... but we sssshall move on."

event.name: ANOMALY_QUESTIONS_3
event.text: "Quesssstion five, the lasssst of... our quessstionsss today. Do you believe in... gods?"

event.name: ANOMALY_QUESTIONS_4
event.text: The Slug says nothing, only jotting down some more notes. You sit there uncomfortably watching him, and notice outside it seems as if everything else has stopped moving, frozen in time and place.

At last, the Slug finally looks up. "Thissss hereby concludes the... quesstionaire. Thank you for your... participation. You will be... compensated for your time. Farewell." Without another word the Slug teleports away and his ship jumps, leaving zero traces of FTL signatures.

event.name: ANOMALY_CEL_COVERUP
event.text: Lured in by the distress beacon, you instead find a strange space station unlike any Federation station model you've seen, and several vessels orbiting around it, all Slug transports. You could try sneaking closer to listen but you have no idea how dangerous it might be.

Incredibly little of the conversation from the other ships comes through, due to some kind of sophisticated encryption method you've never seen before. All you catch are some mentions of anomalies, continuity, and that this station in question comes from somewhere far away. While you're listening, you receive a hail from the station owners, revealing a very terrified human-like creature with blue skin.
"Please, you have to help us. I have no idea what happened - one second we were finishing up a sale on some Artillery Lasers and a Minelauncher when there's this evil laugh and we wound up here! I don't even know where HERE is! These Slugs are telling us we're under arrest for violating continuity, but we didn't do anything! I don't even know what a continuity IS! Please, you have to rescue us!"

You usher the crew on board quickly, and along with them a weapon from their cargo that might be of use aboard your ship, in addition to a helping of fuel to get as far as possible from here. To your luck, the Slug ships don't seem to notice! Looks like you'll be able to get out of here safely.
No way are you risking getting involved in whatever is happening here. You put enough distance between yourself and the station until you can no longer hear the captain's pleading.
Whatever is going on here, it's far too risky to get involved.

destroyed.text: "Error - error - error - error - Continuity has failed to be enforced. Sending request for quarant-" The ship explodes before it can let off the signal. Some of the station's crew cheer but you don't have time to celebrate. You quickly prepare to jump away before another one of these things can appear.

event.name: ANOMALY_CEL_COVERUP_FIGHT
event.text: "Unexpected and unapproved interference in continuity enforcement protocols. Attempting correctment. Turn over the anomalous contraband or you will be placed under arrest for violation of continuity."

choice.text: Hand over the crew and the cargo.

event.text: The station owner protests, but with your weapons raised they have no choice but to comply. You feel a bit guilty at the quick betrayal, but you didn't sign up to deal with whatever this is. "Thank you for complying with continuity enforcement protocols. You may now forget this ever happened. Please leave the premises so that anomaly cleanup may commence."

choice.text: Hand over the crew and the cargo.

event.text: "Error. Anomalous element missing. Your deception attempt is considered as an affront to preserving continuity enforcement. You are now guilty of violating protocol 13; harboring anomalous contraband, and protocol 18; removing contraband from or tampering with an anomalous site. Beginning purge."

"By resisting continuity enforcement you are now guilty of violating protocol 13; harboring anomalous contraband, protocol 18; removing contraband from or tampering with an anomalous site, and protocol 24; refusing to comply with an authorized continuity enforcer. Beginning purge."

event.name: ANOMALY_CEL_WALDO
event.text:
Upon first arriving at this beacon, you begin to run preliminary scans until you look up and spot a giant and strangely colored Slug vessel inspecting the beacon, which doesn't show up on anything other than your proximity alert. The ship itself seems as shocked to see you as you are. A well dressed Slug in a grey suit appears on your screen.
"I ssshould inform you, ssstranger, that you were not... meant to sssee thissss. But... sssince you are here, I figure I ssshould asssk. Have you sssseen any... ssssussspicciousss activity in thisss sssyssstem? If ssso, I would like to know." Before you can respond your ship receives a mysterious hail from another location, which you can't quite discern. "Don't tell him anything. Keep the secret, and I'll make it worth your while."

"Mhm... Okay..." You quickly remember that Slugs can read minds and you might have just walked into a trap, but the Slug doesn't push further. "Here'sss my... card, ssstranger. If you ever notice anything... odd, do not hesssitate to call." The Slug beams over a small business card with a circular logo and the header C.E.L., plus a number you don't even know how to call. The ship jumps away shortly after.
You receive another message a little bit after. "Good, you made the right choice. Just find me now, and we'll talk."

The ship jumps away shortly after.
You receive another message a little bit after. "Good, you made the right choice. Just find me now, and we'll talk."

choice.text: Tell the truth; report the message.

event.text: "Thank you... ssstranger. Glory... to the Multiverssse." The Slug reverses his ship and flies off into the distance, where you can just barely make out a humanoid figure vanish as the ship jumps away after him.

event.name: WALDO_TALK
event.text: All of a sudden, a humanoid figure with strangely dead-looking eyes appears before you on your ship, wearing a striped vest. "Great work, getting rid of that guy. My name is Wallace, I'm kind of a celebrity in the Multiverse, in case you didn't know. Now, since you were so generous and kept me out of trouble, I ought to return the favor. Tell me if any of these get your fancy."

event.name: ANOMALY_CEL_BACON
event.text: In the distance, a small planet unpopulated and coated in vegetation shows unusual energy signatures of a still-active vessel. It's a bit odd to find a ship out here, but stranger things have happened.

You pull closer to the planet, and you find the vessel is a standard Gathering craft, not terribly large. A lone Floral sits against its hull, holding some kind of object you can't quite make out. You land a bit of a distance away and trek closer, and the Orchid jumps when it sees you.
"Who are you?!" So startled, the Floral's sign language is shaky and they mess up a few signs which your translator corrects automatically. "This is sacred land! I am the keeper of the sacred slab of meat, and you are disturbing the sanctity of this land!"

The Orchid leans in closer, staring at you intensely. "The sacred slab of meat. If you really do not know, then I see you are clearly not working with the Slug in the suit!" The Orchid nods to itself contently. "Good, then you are welcome here, as long as you agree to respect the divinity of the sacred slab."

choice.text: The Slug in the suit?! What are you even saying?

event.text: "Long ago, I was but an ordinary flower minding my own business, when from the sky fell a cosmic gift!" The Orchid reaches into their pocket and pulls out a moldly slice of bacon, waving it to you carelessly. "This is the sacred slab! It fell straight from the leaves of Cyrtal'y Mncolo, the tree of life! I was chosen to protect the slab with my life from the jackals of hell! The Slugs in suits! Ever since that day a man in a suit and briefcase has been following me, trying to take the slab! But I shan't relent! Never! The slab must be protected!"

choice.text: Offer to take the Orchid with you to protect it.

event.text: "You wish to escort the sacred slab as well? Well... I suppose it is safer than hiding here, where it is only a matter of time until the suited ones find me... Fine! I will come with you, but you must never attempt to separate me from the slab!"

choice.text: (G-Van) "Jussst give me the... bacon. It'ssss for the... ssssafety of everyone, including you."

event.text: The Orchid shrieks, the first sound they've made since you landed. "No! No! You found me again!" The Orchid retracts the bacon and in desperation shoves it down its beak. G-Van facepalms in frustration. "Oh for... damn it. That bacon comesss from... another clussster. How it... ended up here, isss... uncertain, but I sssussspect foul eldritch play. Either way, it containssss... DNA sssampless from individualsss who do not exissst here, and ssso it mussst be dessstroyed or returned." G-Van blinks. "I ssssuppossse the only choice I have now that doesssn't involve... murder isss to take the Orchid with usss and hope for the bessst."

choice.text: Let the insane Orchid be and leave.

event.text: Curious as you are there's no reason to go snooping around here.

event.name: ANOMALY_ORACLE_REAL
event.text: You jump into an unremarkable beacon, with nothing to show but a few distant abandoned planets and a resource-stripped asteroid field. Now seems like a good time to relax and look for something to do on the ship.
